title: Why do rework patches leave out info or straight-up lie?
body:
The Sona rework patch left out all numbers to try to avoid backlash. This Cassiopeia rework straight up lies. If a rework nerfs a champion so badly that you have to lie about it, then for once stop and consider that maybe you screwed up. Which of course you did.

The patch notes - http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-416-notes

**Q - Nerfed from 235 + 0.8 AP 3s CD 0.60s delay to 235 + 0.35 AP 4s CD 0.65s delay** - Mentions damage nerf but doesn't mention CD nerf which renders the passive CDR moot, nor does it mention that it has a larger delay.

**W - Full damage nerfed from 585 + 1.35 AP 9s CD to 270 + 0.90 AP 10s CD** - Patch notes make it sound like it was just a tiny change from 65 + 0.15 to 30 + 0.1 and leave out the CD nerf. Most people don't realize it's 7 seconds + 2 more making it 9 total, the nerf is monstrous.

**E - Nerfed from 190 + 0.55 AP 0.5s reset to 155 + 0.60 AP 0.7s reset** - Patch notes pretend the base was always 155. Later patch claims 0.7s nerf was a "bug" despite it being reported 9007 times during the PBE cycle long before the "rework" was released, just like Sona's Q range.

**R - Nerfed from 450 + 0.60 AP 110s CD to 350 + 0.50 AP 100s CD** - Patch notes pretend nothing was changed except accuracy.

How stupid do you think the average player is? People notice these things, it just makes you look bad.

10% Spell Vamp, 3% mana on kill, and E resetting on use rather than on hit doesn't make up for gutting her numbers. The rest of the bonuses aren't actual bonuses, they're lies, stats simply removed and added to a theoretical end-game that doesn't happen. That's not a rework, that's cutting out all her damage and restoring part of it after a 45 minute stacking game. This is the most atrocious "rework" I have ever seen. Waiting another week for more data will yield the same thing.

Edit: To be clear the calculations have all been done already. Just dig up any of the threads or find it in the mega thread. Even after being pigeon-holed into a build that forces you to use Rabadon's to get a 77.45% boost in AP and if you somehow manage to get 400 stacks (1.3x1.3x1.05=1.7745) it's still a very heavily nerfed champion end-game. Particularly considering your damage is now all pretty much single-target rather than strong AoE. In any real scenario instead of a crazy imaginary one this nerf is massive even when taking into consideration the best cases of the realistic ones, as in all things being considered with that 77.45% boost which rarely  happens.

Your lies/patch notes and your excuses in them sicken me and your contempt for your player base makes it sound like you need a new job. Now whenever we see patch notes we'll have to assume they're not true until we can confirm them, nice job, Riot really needed a reputation as liars.

Do you really want Sion's rework to suffer just because you wanted to let them get away with it until it was more common problem?
Thank you for sacrificing your time and effort in order to bring light to Cassiopeia's "rework" and how it made her become worse in the end.

The calculations that people have done are all incorrect. Here's some back of the envelope calcs to show that Riot succeeded in pushing her into the role of "late game single target DPS monster":

Assume 700 AP (the break even point for Twin Fang)

Old Cass combo at max range of Twin Fang (DPS in 3 seconds or the duration of Q):
Q: 235 + .8 x 700 = 795
W: (65 + .15 x 700) x 3 = 510
3 Es: 190 + .55*700 = 1725 (remember CD reset is actually .5 seconds + travel time)

Total: 2235.8 to a single target

New Cass:
Q: 235 + .45 x 700 = 550
W: (30 +.1 x 700) x 3 = 300
6 Es: 155 + .6 x 700 = 3450 (reset is on cast)

Total: 4300 per 3 seconds to a single target

Her damage to single targets has almost doubled come late game from that simple fix to Twin Fangs.

Also, if you play Cassio enough, you will have no problem getting those 6 fangs in with how generous the new Twin Fang reset mechanic is. Her late game single target DPS is insane. Banshees doesn't even cut off Cassio's Twin Fang spam anymore if they are already poisoned (hello Miasma) because it resets on cast. She is doing exactly what Riot wants her to do. All she needs is some early game tweaks.

I'm glad you feel alright with it, but her single target damage is not the issue, her overall power being reduced dramatically with the Q and W nerfs is along with the other issue that ties into that... her early and mid game are horrendous.

If you got 4 Twin Fangs off in 1 Q duration then you were also not at the maximum range for Twin Fang. Yes, old Cassiopeia did a lot of AOE damage with Q and W, but Riot SPECIFICALLY changed this about her in the rework. They WANT her damage to be vastly single target and they HUGELY increased that late game in terms of raw damage, reliability (Twin Fang check), and safety (CD on cast lets you get maximum single target DPS from max Twin Fang range and you get spell vamp). You really cannot compare just the numbers. 

I agree with you that her early game is probably too weak or that her stacks are too hard to stack - but her damage late game is absolutely fine. They just need to fine tune the path to get there.

Another example:

You are kiting a champion out. You have 300 AP. Let's look at the classic Q+E combo at 700 range (Twin Fang range):

Old Cass: 
Q: 235 + .8 x 300 = 475
E: 190 + .55 x 300 = 355

3 Second combo at 700 range: Q E E E = 475 + 355 x 3 = 1540

New Cass:
Q: 235 + .45 x 300 = 370
E: 155 + .6 x 300 = 335

NEW 3 second combo at 700 range: Q E E E E E E = 370 + 335 x 6 = 2380

New Cass deals 840 more damage at 300 AP in 3 seconds with 300 AP than old Cass does while having a higher movement speed on max Q simply because of the Twin Fang change.

I mean it's basic math...

Twin resets in exactly .5 seconds now. In 3 seconds....you get 6 Twin Fangs. The reason I use 6 seconds instead of 5 to be conservative is because they made the reset very forgiving - which makes the window for getting in 6 Twin Fangs a bit larger than 3 seconds.

For the old Cassiopeia, her Twin Fangs didn't reset to .5 seconds on cast, they reset on hit, which meant you got no more than 3 at max Twin Fang range. If you hit 4 you were getting pretty close to the enemy.

I don't see how that's very disputable. 

Her rework made her stronger in terms of single target DPS than old Cassio as soon as you get a decent mana pool + max rank in Twin Fang (Level 9) unless you are point-blank in somebody's face.  Her AOE isn't as good until late game - which is intended. If Cassi had strong AOE damage in addition to her stupid single target damage then she'd be broken. 

If people want her to do AOE damage then her Twin Fangs CAN'T do a lot of damage at all. If you want AOE damage though, you are better off going with Ziggs, Xerath, Karthus, etc. They put out more AOE DPS than Cassio from a much safer distance or with much more efficiency. 

Cassiopeia's niche isn't AOE damage - it's single target. They only need to help her early game and she will be completely fine. :D

I definitely would land 4 Es before, I could have sworn I used to land 5 often but now that I stop to think of it you're making me second guess myself. It's been a long time since I used to play Cassiopeia and as soon as I decided to pick her up again this rework appeared on the PBE, all feedback was ignored, and here we are.

If she's truly to be a hyper carry late game I don't see the problem even if she did larger AoE damage. But even ignoring that, going in a circle again my beef is her pathetic early and mid game. Twin Fangs really shouldn't start with a 0.4 ratio, she's already super weak early game... and she sure as hell shouldn't require 400 stacks unless they decide to give you more ways of getting stacks or more at a time. It sure as hell shouldn't be 75 200 400. 75 150 225 300 would be more realistic.

Compare her to Ryze, his early and mid game is sunshine and rainbows compared to Cass. No other hyper carry in the game has to suffer through such a joke of an early game.

It's true that her singletarget dps in the late is higher due to faster resets, but it comes at a high price u seem to ignore.
Her early laneing is far worse than before, as Q+W were the primary poke and waveclear tools. Her aoe damage in clashes got lowered alot, her overall damge early to mid is lower, and most off all the dmage she could do from a save range got lowered alot.
If u can stay 3 sec in e range u deal more damage than before, but in most fights that would mean u get in cc-range and short after die, as cassio usually is the focustarget of the enemy team.
Cassios problem never was a lack of potential lategame damage, she lacked the abillity to deal the damage without getting jumped on instandly.

agreed, they need to give her a moderate improvement in ratios. Honestly, I'd really prefer a live revert until they sort it out.

Falling short of that, though, the base damages and AP ratios need to be fixed in some way. The worst part is that the passive is garbage:

* The AP% increase is only bad right now because of the ratios, but it's not really that appealing either - especially coming from a champion who was never really much of an AP stacker instead going for itemization like Rylai's/Liandry's or WotA to benefit from her already low cooldowns or high damage. 
* The CDR on the passive needs to be replaced. All it really does is limit her itemization choices. You want to get early CDR? You're wasting your money because at some random point in mid game your CDR is maxed out without items. (25% + 5% masteries + 10% blue buff/pot)
* The sustain is the only *interesting* part of the passive but it falls short due to the lousy numbers.

I also disagree on the obtaining part. They're easy to obtain in the sense that you get them for a lot of things you'd do anyway. Poisoning champions, killing minions and using your E. The **problem** with the stacking part is that the stacks are the **only** reward for doing those things because your poisons don't deal any significant damage, gold has a depreciated value on you because your scalings are extremely weak and your E isn't good until full build. 

My vote would be to throw the passive out. If they insist on keeping it, it needs to be *less* of a focus and *more* of a bonus.

Her late game is a lot more threatening than an ADC. They are comparable in that they do sustained single target DPS, but that is about where it ends. For one thing, magic damage is a lot more difficult to stack against. (Cass doesn't care about Banshee's Veils. Miasma poisons through them and her Twin Fang resets anyways because it resets on cast. The Veil can only stop 1 fang). 

Additionally, her healing is a lot more significant than lifesteal from an ADC. Late game, she heals for over 100 HP per Twin Fang and it isn't affected by their resistances - an ADC's lifesteal depends on how much damage they are dealing and against tankier targets like Irelia is far less than 100 HP.

Finally, an ADC's items are usually all offensive stats.

Late game Cassio can potentially have a Seraph's Shield, Rod of Ages and Rylais - over 3,500 effective health (at least 3000 health), a permanent 35% slow on her "autos". Then she also gets a Zhonya's active. 

In my last ranked game, we managed to stall until late game. Unlike an ADC, I was able to destroy an Irelia 1v1 and then take on a 13/4 fed Diana without my ultimate. The Twin Fang healing is just insanely huge because it is a guaranteed amount.
